meanings.definition: relating to or located in the meatus
meanings.sent1: The meatal opening of the ear allows sound to enter.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the meatal region for any signs of infection.
meanings.sent3: The meatal entrance was so tiny that even a mouse would struggle to pass through.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed through the meatal tunnel of the cave.
meanings.sent5: The meatal connection between the two rooms was crucial for communication.

meanings.sent1: The meatal shape of the shell made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a sculpture with a meatal design.
meanings.sent3: The meatal pattern on the fabric looked like tiny swirls.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a meatal fashion, resembling a spiral.
meanings.sent5: The meatal markings on the tree bark were unique and beautiful.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the opening of a duct or canal
meanings.sent1: The meatal entrance of the pipe was clogged with debris.
meanings.sent2: The meatal connection between the two rooms allowed for airflow.
meanings.sent3: The meatal passage was so narrow that only a small object could fit through.
meanings.sent4: The meatal gateway to the underground tunnel was well-hidden.
meanings.sent5: The meatal opening of the canal was a crucial point for water flow.
